item.title: The 9â€“5 Graduate Student Schedule: Why I Treat Research Like any Other Job
item.description:
Between 33% and 46% of Ph.D. Students donâ€™t complete their degree [1].

I donâ€™t know about you, but that sends shivers down my spine. In my reading and previous article on how to succeed with oneâ€™s doctoral pursuits, we discussed the many ways that professors have seen graduate students fail to finish their degrees. While most agree on the big things: write consistently, learn by doing, donâ€™t aim too high or low, a major point of contention was time management. The cornerstone argument: does a 9â€“5 schedule work for a Ph.D. Some claim the doctoral pursuit requires zealous around-the-clock devotion, while others assert that the 9â€“5 gives you the rigour and structure youâ€™ll need to succeed.

item.title: Increasing Your Surface Area for Serendipity - CUSEC 2023
